content: 1 PAUL, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
content_old: 1 PAUL, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

content: 2 and to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
content_old: 2 and to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

content: 3 Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 3 Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 4 I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
content_old: 4 I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

content: 5 hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
content_old: 5 hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

content: 6 that the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 6 that the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

content: 7 For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
content_old: 7 For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

content: 8 Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
content_old: 8 Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

content: 9 yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
content_old: 9 yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

content: 10 I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
content_old: 10 I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

content: 11 which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
content_old: 11 which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

content: 12 whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
content_old: 12 whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

content: 13 whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
content_old: 13 whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

content: 14 but without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
content_old: 14 but without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

content: 15 For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
content_old: 15 For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

content: 16 not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
content_old: 16 not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

content: 17 If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
content_old: 17 If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

content: 18 If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
content_old: 18 If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

content: 19 I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
content_old: 19 I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

content: 20 Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
content_old: 20 Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

content: 21 Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
content_old: 21 Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

content: 22 But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
content_old: 22 But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

content: 23 There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
content_old: 23 There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

content: 24 Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
content_old: 24 Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
